Description: Ovoid jar in Nile clay with rolled everted lip, narrow neck, wide shoulders and tapering to a flat base. The interior of the mouth has a strainer, made in one piece with the vessel. One side slightly broken and restored. Rim worn with use.
Cultures/periods: Nubia and Sudan periods and cultures
Curator's comments: Compare G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' I (London, 1927), pl. XV, p2L2, 92L3. Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 14.
